body_html:
So yes, someone could in theory use the ATen API, call the _out version of the function with a gradInput that:

  1. has the correct size
  2. is not contiguous

and break some code that relies on the contiguity assumption (a lot of our code assumes that gradInput is contiguous) as a result.
body_text:
So yes, someone could in theory use the ATen API, call the _out version of the function with a gradInput that:

has the correct size
is not contiguous

and break some code that relies on the contiguity assumption (a lot of our code assumes that gradInput is contiguous) as a result.
body:
So yes, someone could in theory use the ATen API, call the _out version of the function with a gradInput that:
1) has the correct size
2) is not contiguous

and break some code that relies on the contiguity assumption (a lot of our code assumes that gradInput is contiguous) as a result.
